text:
Content negotiation results in english pages when german is the first priority
within the browser for Netscape 4.7x and Opera 6!
With IE 6, Mozilla and Amaya content negotiation seems to work perfectly.
creator: hofmann@hofmann-int.de

text:
The fact that some browsers work while others don't strongly suggests a client
configuration problem.  Are you sure the browsers are sending "de" and not
"de-something" in their Accept-Language header?

I'm closing this report, but if you can verify that there is a bug in Apache,
then please reopen it.  Such a verification would require at least the contents
of the Accept-Language request headers from the clients and information on how
you have configured your server.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
One suggestion.  Are the suspect browsers sending Accept-Language: de, en
as the acceptable variants?  If so, language priority has taken precidence.

  Accept variants need to be weighted if you want the value proportioned,
that is Q=.7 for de and Q=.3 for en, etc.  Otherwise, the browser is requesting
that any de or en language is equally acceptable (the default Quality value is 1.)
creator: wrowe@apache.org
